summary:
• The Taliban has restricted opportunities for Afghan women in society.
• Many Afghan women are leading secret lives online to circumvent these restrictions.
• These women use social media platforms to connect with others and access information despite the lack of personal freedom.

• A tornado hit a Chinese city, causing debris to fly through the air.
• The tornado caused significant damage and disruption in the affected area.
• Emergency responders were quickly deployed to assist those affected by the disaster.

• France has drawn a line under its troubled election campaign.
• The country prepares for a pivotal moment in its history with an upcoming vote.
• Fifty violent incidents have shaken France just days from the ballot box.

• Hungary's Prime Minister meets with Putin in Moscow
• Viktor Orban visits Moscow, upsetting EU allies
• Hungary's leader visits Moscow, causing tension

• A hardliner and a reformist will face each other in the Iranian presidential runoff.
• The country is holding an election to choose its next leader.
• Low voter turnout could indicate dissatisfaction with the government or other factors affecting participation.

• Israel's settlement construction in East Jerusalem sparks tensions with Palestinians over land ownership.
• The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is marked by ongoing disputes over territory and resources.
• Despite efforts to negotiate a peaceful resolution, talks between Israel and Hamas remain inconclusive.

• Hurricane Beryl has left Jamaica after causing damage.
• The storm is now heading towards the Cayman Islands.
• Jamaica was severely affected by the hurricane's passage.

• Japan has effectively ended its reliance on floppy disks.
• Despite this progress, many Japanese companies still use outdated technology.
• The country's fondness for legacy systems persists despite efforts to modernize.

• The Kenyan leader faced intense criticism from young people during an online debate
• The confrontation highlighted concerns over youth unemployment and lack of opportunities
• The exchange sparked widespread discussion about the government's role in addressing these issues

• Hurricane Beryl hits Mexico's coast
• Tourist hotspots affected by hurricane

• A couple celebrates 50 years of marriage in a city known as "Nigeria's divorce capital"
• The celebration highlights the rarity of long-lasting marriages in this particular region
• Despite being in a place infamous for high rates of marital separation, they have managed to maintain their union for five decades

• Romanian authorities allow Andrew Tate to leave the country
• However, he remains banned from entering the European Union due to his controversial past
• This decision comes after concerns over his involvement in human trafficking and online harassment cases

• Power outages force medical professionals in Ukraine to perform surgeries by candlelight.
• The Russian invasion has severely damaged Ukraine's energy infrastructure, leaving many communities without access to reliable power.
• In response, Ukraine is rebuilding its energy sector with a focus on renewable energy sources like solar and wind power.

• The UK has elected a new PM, Keir Starmer.
• Labour's historic win marks an end to 14 years of Conservative rule.
• Key figures in Starmer's new government remain unknown.

• Biden faces donor pressure over his re-election campaign.
• Wildfires have forced evacuations in California.
• Biden has vowed to remain in the race and defeat Trump.
